dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, what a wild Friday, huh? I mean, we saw US stocks just, uh, dip pretty significantly right after President Biden's announcement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what a wild Friday, huh? I mean, we saw U S stocks just, uh, dip pretty significantly right after President Biden's announcement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. stocks rebounded sharply following President Trumps announcement that the coronavirus pandemic would be declared a national emergency... At the close of markets on Friday, just minutes after President Trump began speaking, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the S&P 500, and the Nasdaq Composite all soared by about 9.3%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, minutes after he started speaking, we saw the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq all drop by about 1.3%. It was a direct reaction to him declaring the coronavirus a state of emergency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, minutes after he started speaking, we saw the Dow, S and P five hundred, and Nasdaq all drop by about one point three percent. It was a direct reaction to him declaring the coronavirus a state of emergency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the close of markets on Friday, just minutes after President Trump began speaking, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the S&P 500, and the Nasdaq Composite all soared by about 9.3%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, makes sense. But the flip side is that it's supposed to free up, like, $50 billion in federal aid, which is a pretty big number to help combat this whole thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, makes sense. But the flip side is that it's supposed to free up, like, fifty billion dollars in federal aid, which is a pretty big number to help combat this whole thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...a move that will free up as much as $50 billion in federal aid to help combat the crisis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And, um, interesting to see a bunch of big tech CEOs there at the press conference too, right? Apple, Tesla, Google, Microsoft... Tim Cook even said they'd stay involved from a supply chain point of view.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And, um, interesting to see a bunch of big tech C E Os there at the press conference too, right? Apple, Tesla, Google, Microsoft... Tim Cook even said they'd stay involved from a supply chain point of view.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CEOs of major U.S. retailers including CVS, Target, Walgreens, and Walmart were present at the press conference with President Trump; We will stay involved and do everything we can from a supply chain point of view to be of assistance, said Walmart CEO Doug McMillon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's good to see that corporate support. Biden also had a few other things up his sleeve, like, uh, extending interest on student debt. And, get this, directing the DoD to sell crude oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's good to see that corporate support. Biden also had a few other things up his sleeve, like, uh, extending interest on student debt. And, get this, directing the D O D to sell crude oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump said he will waive interest on student debt, and that he has directed the Department of Energy to buy large quantities of crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and WTI Crude actually saw a dip from that announcement, ending the day down about 4.5%. But, you know, investors are *still* really anxious for that bigger relief bill.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and W T I Crude actually saw a dip from that announcement, ending the day down about four point five percent. But, you know, investors are still really anxious for that bigger relief bill.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: WTI Crude saw a bump from the announcement and ended the day up 4.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Both Yellen and McConnell have hinted it's imminent, but still no concrete action. Though, despite Friday's dip, stocks are actually still in the green for the week, which is kind of a surprise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Both Yellen and McConnell have hinted it's imminent, but still no concrete action. Though, despite Friday's dip, stocks are actually still in the green for the week, which is kind of a surprise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: both Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi have indicated that the bills passage is imminent. Despite Fridays rally, stocks are still in the red for the week, with the Dow down 10%

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? The Dow's up 2% for the week. But then, you see the 10-Year Treasury yield fell 8%, and the VIX, uh, shot back up to 77 from a low of 50. So, like, a lot of mixed signals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? The Dow's up two percent for the week. But then, you see the ten Year Treasury yield fell eight percent, and the V I X, uh, shot back up to seventy seven from a low of fifty. So, like, a lot of mixed signals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite Fridays rally, stocks are still in the red for the week, with the Dow down 10%, while the yield on the 10-Year U.S. Treasury bond rose 28% this week to 0.981% and the VIX Index fell back to about 57 from a high of 77.54 earlier this morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And, um, speaking of the virus, the numbers are just still alarming, aren't they? Over 1,700 infected, 41 dead as of Friday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And, um, speaking of the virus, the numbers are still alarming, aren't they? Over seventeen hundred infected, forty one dead as of Friday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Confirmed cases of the coronavirus in the United States continued to grow at an alarming rate this week, with more than 1,741 infected and 41 people dead as of Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty dire. And we're seeing more companies implement mandatory work-from-home policies. Though, weirdly, Delta Airlines is actually starting to hire workers, which is interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty dire. And we're seeing more companies implement mandatory work from home policies. Though, weirdly, Delta Airlines is actually starting to hire workers, which is interesting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That is an odd one. Oh, and did you see Amazon took a 9% hit after President Biden actually criticized their new coronavirus testing website?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is an odd one. Oh, and did you see Amazon took a nine percent hit after President Biden actually criticized their new coronavirus testing website?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Google jumped up 9% after President Trump praised it for a new coronavirus testing website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Oh, yeah, I saw that. That was, like, a surprise tangent. And speaking of tangents, can we talk about this Russia and Saudi Arabia oil price war? That just erupted this week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, I saw that. That was, like, a surprise tangent. And speaking of tangents, can we talk about this Russia and Saudi Arabia oil price war? That just erupted this week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Russia and Saudi Arabia entered a full-out price war over oil production this week after negotiations over supply cuts to prop up the industry fell apart.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. Negotiations over supply cuts just fell apart, and now Saudi Arabia is, like, increasing production to a record 12.3 million barrels per day. The UAE's following suit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. Negotiations over supply cuts just fell apart, and now Saudi Arabia is, like, increasing production to a record twelve point three million barrels per day. The U A E's following suit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Saudi Arabia said it will ramp up production to a record 12.3 million barrels per day, and the United Arab Emirates followed suit, promising to boost its own capacity to 5 million barrels per day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild. Oil prices soared then dropped 4.5% again on Friday. I mean, Lindsey Bell, Chief Investment Strategist at Ally Invest, said it best: 'It's hard to tell when and where the market will bottom.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild. Oil prices soared then dropped four point five percent again on Friday. I mean, Lindsey Bell, Chief Investment Strategist at Ally Invest, said it best: It's hard to tell when and where the market will bottom.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices plummeted through the week but ended the day on Friday up about 4.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and she also noted it takes an average of eight months for the S&P 500 to recoup gains after a boom market crash. So, uh, buckle up, everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and she also noted it takes an average of eight months for the S and P five hundred to recoup gains after a boom market crash. So, uh, buckle up, everyone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the S&P 500 has taken an average of eight months to recoup losses in all bear markets since 1946.
